member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.TablesOfAuthorities
member.summary: A collection of objects (TOA fields) that represents the tables of authorities in a document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.TablesOfAuthorities.Add(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Returns a object that represents a table of authorities added to a document.
member.param: Optional Object. True to apply formatting from table of authorities entries to the entries in the table of authorities. Corresponds to the \f switch for a Table of Authorities (TOA) field. If this argument is omitted, KeepEntryFormatting is assumed to be True.

Optional Object. The string name of the bookmark from which you want to collect entries for the table of authorities. If Bookmark is specified, the entries are collected only from the portion of the document marked by the bookmark. Corresponds to the \b switch for a Table of Authorities (TOA) field.

Optional Object. True to replace five or more page references to the same authority with Passim in the table of authorities. Corresponds to the \p switch for a Table of Authorities (TOA) field. If this argument is omitted, Passim is assumed to be False.
Required object. The range where you want the table of authorities to appear. The table of authorities replaces the range if the range isn't collapsed.

Optional Object. The characters (up to five) between each sequence number and its page number in the table of authorities. Corresponds to the \d switch for a Table of Authorities (TOA) field. If argument is omitted, a hyphen (-) is used.
Optional Object. A string that specifies the Sequence (SEQ) field identifier for the table of authorities. Corresponds to the \s switch for a Table of Authorities (TOA) field.

Optional Object. The category of entries you want to include in the table of authorities. Corresponds to the \c switch for a Table of Authorities (TOA) field. Values 0 through 16 correspond to the items listed in the Category box on the Table of Authorities tab in the Index and Tables dialog box (Reference command, Insert menu). The default value is 1.

Optional Object. The characters (up to five) that separate the beginning and ending page numbers in each page range the table of authorities. Corresponds to the \g switch for a Table of Authorities (TOA) field. If this argument is omitted, an en dash is used.

Optional Object. The characters (up to five) that separate individual page numbers within page references in the table of authorities. Corresponds to the \l switch for a Table of Authorities (TOA) field. If this argument is omitted, a comma and a space are used.

Optional Object. The characters (up to five) that separate each entry and its page number in the table of authorities. Corresponds to the \e switch for a Table of Authorities (TOA) field. If this argument is omitted, no separator is used.

Optional Object. True to have the category name for each group of entries appear in the table of authorities (for example, Cases). Corresponds to the \h switch for a Table of Authorities (TOA) field. If this argument is omitted, IncludeCategoryHeader is assumed to be True.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.TablesOfAuthorities.MarkAllCitations(System.String,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Inserts a TA (Table of Authorities Entry) field after all instances of the ShortCitation text.
member.param: Optional Object. The long citation string for the entry as it will appear in the table of authorities.

Optional Object. The category number to be associated with the entry: 1 corresponds to the first category in the Category box in the Mark Citation dialog box, 2 corresponds to the second category, and so on.
Optional Object. The AutoText entry name that contains the text of the long citation as it will appear in the table of authorities.
Required String. The short citation for the entry as it will appear in the Mark Citation dialog box (Insert menu, Index and Tables command).

member.summary: Inserts a TA (Table of Authorities Entry) field and returns the field as a object.
member.param: Optional Object. The long citation for the entry as it will appear in the table of authorities.
Required object. The location of the table of authorities entry. The TA field is inserted after Range.

Optional Object. The category number to be associated with the entry: 1 corresponds to the first category in the Category box in the Mark Citation dialog box, 2 corresponds to the second category, and so on.
Optional Object. The name of the AutoText entry that contains the text of the long citation as it will appear in the table of authorities.
Required String. The short citation for the entry as it will appear in the Mark Citation dialog box (Insert menu, Index and Tables command).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.TablesOfContents
member.summary: A collection of objects that represent the tables of contents in a document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.TablesOfContents.Add(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Returns a object that represents a table of contents added to a document.
member.param: Optional Object. True to use outline levels to create the table of contents. The default is False.

Optional Object. True if Table of Contents Entry (TC) fields are used to create the table of contents. Use the method to mark entries to be included in the table of contents. The default value is False.

Optional Object. A one-letter identifier that's used to build a table of contents from TC fields. Corresponds to the \f switch for a Table of Contents (TOC) field. For example, "T" builds a table of contents from TC fields using the table identifier T. If this argument is omitted, TC fields aren't used.
Optional Object. True if page numbers in the table of contents are aligned with the right margin. The default value is True.
Required object. The range where you want the table of contents to appear. The table of contents replaces the range if the range isn't collapsed.
Optional Object. True if entries in a table of contents should be formatted as hyperlinks when the document is being publishing to the Web. The default value is True.
Optional Object. True to include page numbers in the table of contents. The default value is True.
Optional Object. The starting heading level for the table of contents. Corresponds to the starting value used with the \o switch for a Table of Contents (TOC) field. The default value is 1.
Optional Object. The ending heading level for the table of contents. Corresponds to the ending value used with the \o switch for a Table of Contents (TOC) field. The default value is 9.

Optional Object. The string name for additional styles used to compile the table of contents (styles other than the Heading 1 – Heading 9 styles). Use the method of a object to create new heading styles.
Optional Object. True to use built-in heading styles to create the table of contents. The default value is True.
Optional Object. True to use outline levels to create the table of contents. The default is False.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.TablesOfContents.MarkEntry(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Inserts a TC (Table of Contents Entry) field after the specified range. The method returns a object representing the TC field.
member.param: Optional Object. The AutoText entry name that includes text for the index, table of figures, or table of contents (Entry is ignored).
Optional Object. A one-letter identifier for the table of figures or table of contents item (for example, "i" for an "illustration").
Required object. The location of the entry. The TC field is inserted after Range.
Optional Object. A level for the entry in the table of contents or table of figures.

Optional Object. The text that appears in the table of contents or table of figures. To indicate a subentry, include the main entry text and the subentry text, separated by a colon (:) (for example, "Introduction:The Product").

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.TablesOfContents.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an individual object in a collection.
member.param: An Integer indicating the ordinal position of the individual object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.TablesOfFigures
member.summary: A collection of objects that represent the tables of figures in a document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.TablesOfFigures.Add(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Returns a object that represents a table of figures added to a document.
member.param: Optional Object. True align page numbers with the right margin in the table of figures. The default value is True.
Optional Object. True if page numbers in a table of figures should be hidden when publishing to the Web. The default value is True.

Optional Object. True to use Table of Contents Entry (TC) fields to create the table of figures. Use the method to mark entries you want to include in the table of figures. The default value is False.

Optional Object. A one-letter identifier that's used to build a table of figures from Table of Contents Entry (TC) fields. Corresponds to the \f switch for a Table of Contents (TOC) field. For example, "i" builds a table of figures for an illustration.
Optional Object. True to include the caption label and caption number in the table of figures. The default value is True.
Optional Object. The label that identifies the items you want to include in the table of figures. Corresponds to the \c switch for a Table of Contents (TOC) field. The default value is "Figure."
Required object. The range where you want the table of figures to appear.
Optional Object. True if entries in a table of figures should be formatted as hyperlinks when publishing to the Web. The default value is True.
Optional Object. True if page numbers are included in the table of figures. The default value is True.

Optional Object. The starting heading level for the table of figures, if UseHeadingStyles is set to True. Corresponds to the starting value used with the \o switch for a Table of Contents (TOC) field. The default value is 1.

Optional Object. The ending heading level for the table of figures, if UseHeadingStyles is set to True. Corresponds to the ending value used with the \o switch for a Table of Contents (TOC) field. The default value is 9.
Optional Object. The string name for additional styles used to compile the table of figures (styles other than the Heading 1 – Heading 9 styles).
Optional Object. True to use built-in heading styles to create the table of figures. The default value is False.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.ThreeDFormat.IncrementRotationY(System.Single)
member.summary: Changes the rotation of the specified shape around the y-axis by the specified number of degrees.
member.param: Required Single. Specifies how much (in degrees) the rotation of the shape around the y-axis is to be changed. Can be a value from – 90 through 90. A positive value tilts the shape to the left; a negative value tilts it to the right.

Optional Object. Required if Type is . The trendline order. Must be an integer from 2 to 6, inclusive.
Optional Object. The number of periods (or units on a scatter chart) that the trendline extends backward.
Optional . The trendline type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.View.ReadingLayoutAllowEditing
member.summary: Returns a Boolean that represents whether to allow editing of text in Reading Layout mode. Read/write.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.View.ReadingLayoutAllowMultiplePages

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.View.ReadingLayoutTruncateMargins

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Walls
member.summary: Represents the walls of a 3-D chart. This object isn’t a collection. There’s no object that represents a single wall; you must return all the walls as a unit.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Walls.ClearFormats
member.summary: Clears the formatting of the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Walls.Paste
member.summary: Pastes a picture from the Clipboard on the walls of the specified chart.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Walls.Select
member.summary: Selects the object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Walls.Application
member.summary: When used without an object qualifier, this property returns an object that represents the Microsoft Word application. When used with an object qualifier, this property returns an Application object that represents the creator of the specified object (you can use this property with an OLE Automation object to return the application of that object). Read-only.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Walls.Border
member.summary: Returns a object that represents the border of the object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Walls.Creator
member.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created. Read-only Integer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Walls.Fill
member.summary: Returns a object for a specified chart that contains fill formatting properties for the chart.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Walls.Format
member.summary: Returns the line, fill, and effect formatting for the object. Read-only .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Walls.Interior
member.summary: Returns an object that represents the interior of the specified object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Walls.Name
member.summary: Returns a String value that represents the name of the object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Walls.Parent
member.summary: Returns the parent for the specified object. Read-only Object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Walls.PictureType
member.summary: Returns or sets a Object value that represents the way pictures are displayed on the walls and faces of a 3-D chart.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Walls.PictureUnit
member.summary: Returns or sets the unit for each picture on the chart if the property is set to (if not, this property is ignored). Read/write Integer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Walls.Thickness
member.summary: Returns or sets a Integer specifying the thickness of the wall. Read/write.

member.summary: Tracks the differences between the two files using tracked changes in the revised document.

member.summary: Specifies what bookmarks to include when exporting a document.

member.summary: Create a bookmark in the exported document for each Microsoft Office Word heading, which includes only headings within the main document and text boxes not within headers, footers, endnotes, footnotes, or comments.

member.summary: Do not create bookmarks in the exported document.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdExportCreateBookmarks.wdExportCreateWordBookmarks
member.summary: Create a bookmark in the exported document for each Word bookmark, which includes all bookmarks except those contained within headers and footers.

member.summary: A field that's automatically updated each time it's displayed or each time the page is reformatted, but which can also be manually updated (for example, INCLUDEPICTURE or FORMDROPDOWN).

member.summary: An invalid field (for example, a pair of field characters with nothing inside).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdFieldKind.wdFieldKindWarm
member.summary: A field that can be updated and has a result. This type includes fields that are automatically updated when the source changes as well as fields that can be manually updated (for example, DATE or INCLUDETEXT).

member.summary: Microsoft Word interprets the height or width of the specified frame as a fixed value (in points).

member.summary: Word interprets the height or width of the specified frame as a percentage of the screen height or width.

member.summary: Word interprets the height or width of the specified frame as relative to the height or width of other frames on the frames page.

member.summary: Sets the height or width to a value equal to or greater than the value specified by the Height property or Width property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdFrameSizeRule.wdFrameAuto

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdFrameSizeRule.wdFrameExact
member.summary: Sets the height or width to an exact value specified by the Height property or Width property.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdHebSpellStart
member.summary: Specifies which rules the Hebrew spelling checker will follow.

member.summary: The spelling checker follows rules for the conventional script required by the Hebrew Language Academy for writing text without diacritics.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdHebSpellStart.wdMixedAuthorizedScript
member.summary: The spelling checker follows rules for full and partial script, but highlights as potential mistakes any spelling variations not permitted within either system and any completely unrecognized words.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdHebSpellStart.wdMixedScript
member.summary: The spelling checker follows rules for full and partial script and allows non-conventional spelling variations. Only completely unrecognized words are highlighted as potential mistakes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdHebSpellStart.wdPartialScript
member.summary: The spelling checker follows rules for the traditional script used only for text with diacritics.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdHorizontalLineWidthType
member.summary: Specifies how Word interprets the width (length) of the specified horizontal line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdHorizontalLineWidthType.wdHorizontalLineFixedWidth
member.summary: Microsoft Word interprets the width (length) of the specified horizontal line as a fixed value (in points). This is the default value for horizontal lines added with the AddHorizontalLine method. Setting the Width property for the InlineShape object associated with a horizontal line sets the WidthType property to this value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdHorizontalLineWidthType.wdHorizontalLinePercentWidth
member.summary: Word interprets the width (length) of the specified horizontal line as a percentage of the screen width. This is the default value for horizontal lines added with the AddHorizontalLineStandard method. Setting the PercentWidth property on a horizontal line sets the WidthType property to this value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation
member.summary: Specifies the type of information returned about a specified selection or range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdActiveEndAdjustedPageNumber
member.summary: Returns the number of the page that contains the active end of the specified selection or range. If you set a starting page number or make other manual adjustments, returns the adjusted page number (unlike wdActiveEndPageNumber).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdActiveEndPageNumber
member.summary: Returns the number of the page that contains the active end of the specified selection or range, counting from the beginning of the document. Any manual adjustments to page numbering are disregarded (unlike wdActiveEndAdjustedPageNumber).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdActiveEndSectionNumber
member.summary: Returns the number of the section that contains the active end of the specified selection or range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdAtEndOfRowMarker
member.summary: Returns True if the specified selection or range is at the end-of-row mark in a table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdCapsLock
member.summary: Returns True if Caps Lock is in effect.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdEndOfRangeColumnNumber
member.summary: Returns the table column number that contains the end of the specified selection or range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdEndOfRangeRowNumber
member.summary: Returns the table row number that contains the end of the specified selection or range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdFirstCharacterColumnNumber
member.summary: Returns the character position of the first character in the specified selection or range. If the selection or range is collapsed, the character number immediately to the right of the range or selection is returned (this is the same as the character column number displayed in the status bar after "Col").

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdFirstCharacterLineNumber
member.summary: Returns the character position of the first character in the specified selection or range. If the selection or range is collapsed, the character number immediately to the right of the range or selection is returned (this is the same as the character line number displayed in the status bar after "Ln").

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdFrameIsSelected
member.summary: Returns True if the selection or range is an entire frame or text box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdHeaderFooterType
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates the type of header or footer that contains the specified selection or range, as shown in the following table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdHorizontalPositionRelativeToPage
member.summary: Returns the horizontal position of the specified selection or range; this is the distance from the left edge of the selection or range to the left edge of the page measured in points (1 point = 20 twips, 72 points = 1 inch). If the selection or range isn't within the screen area, returns – 1.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdHorizontalPositionRelativeToTextBoundary
member.summary: Returns the horizontal position of the specified selection or range relative to the left edge of the nearest text boundary enclosing it, in points (1 point = 20 twips, 72 points = 1 inch). If the selection or range isn't within the screen area, returns - 1.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdInClipboard
member.summary: For information about this constant, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdInCommentPane
member.summary: Returns True if the specified selection or range is in a comment pane.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdInEndnote
member.summary: Returns True if the specified selection or range is in an endnote area in print layout view or in the endnote pane in normal view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdInFootnote
member.summary: Returns True if the specified selection or range is in a footnote area in print layout view or in the footnote pane in normal view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdInFootnoteEndnotePane
member.summary: Returns True if the specified selection or range is in the footnote or endnote pane in normal view or in a footnote or endnote area in print layout view. For more information, see the descriptions of wdInFootnote and wdInEndnote in the preceding paragraphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdInHeaderFooter
member.summary: Returns True if the selection or range is in the header or footer pane or in a header or footer in print layout view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdInMasterDocument
member.summary: Returns True if the selection or range is in a master document (that is, a document that contains at least one subdocument).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdInWordMail
member.summary: Returns True if the selection or range is in the header or footer pane or in a header or footer in print layout view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdMaximumNumberOfColumns
member.summary: Returns the greatest number of table columns within any row in the selection or range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdMaximumNumberOfRows
member.summary: Returns the greatest number of table rows within the table in the specified selection or range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdNumberOfPagesInDocument
member.summary: Returns the number of pages in the document associated with the selection or range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdNumLock
member.summary: Returns True if Num Lock is in effect.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdOverType
member.summary: Returns True if Overtype mode is in effect. The Overtype property can be used to change the state of the Overtype mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdReferenceOfType
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates where the selection is in relation to a footnote, endnote, or comment reference, as shown in the following table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdRevisionMarking
member.summary: Returns True if change tracking is in effect.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdSelectionMode
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates the current selection mode, as shown in the following table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdStartOfRangeColumnNumber
member.summary: Returns the table column number that contains the beginning of the selection or range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdStartOfRangeRowNumber
member.summary: Returns the table row number that contains the beginning of the selection or range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdVerticalPositionRelativeToPage
member.summary: Returns the vertical position of the selection or range; this is the distance from the top edge of the selection to the top edge of the page measured in points (1 point = 20 twips, 72 points = 1 inch). If the selection isn't visible in the document window, returns – 1.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdInformation.wdVerticalPositionRelativeToTextBoundary
member.summary: Returns the vertical position of the selection or range relative to the top edge of the nearest text boundary enclosing it, in points (1 point = 20 twips, 72 points = 1 inch). This is useful for determining the position of the insertion point within a frame or table cell. If the selection isn't visible, returns – 1.

member.summary: Returns True if the selection is in a table.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdLayoutMode
member.summary: Specifies how text is laid out in the layout mode for the current document.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdLayoutMode.wdLayoutModeDefault
member.summary: No grid is used to lay out text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdLayoutMode.wdLayoutModeGenko
member.summary: Text is laid out on a grid; the user specifies the number of lines and the number of characters per line. As the user types, Microsoft Word automatically aligns characters with gridlines.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdLayoutMode.wdLayoutModeGrid
member.summary: Text is laid out on a grid; the user specifies the number of lines and the number of characters per line. As the user types, Microsoft Word doesn't automatically align characters with gridlines.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdLayoutMode.wdLayoutModeLineGrid
member.summary: Text is laid out on a grid; the user specifies the number of lines, but not the number of characters per line.

member.summary: Carriage return plus line feed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdLineEndingType.wdCROnly
member.summary: Carriage return only.

member.summary: Line feed plus carriage return.

member.summary: Line feed only.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdLineEndingType.wdLSPS

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdLineSpacing
member.summary: Specifies a line spacing format to be applied to a paragraph.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdLineSpacing.wdLineSpace1pt5
member.summary: Space-and-a-half line spacing. Spacing is equivalent to the current font size plus 6 points.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdLineSpacing.wdLineSpaceAtLeast
member.summary: Line spacing is always at least a specified amount. The amount is specified separately.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdLineSpacing.wdLineSpaceDouble
member.summary: Double spaced.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdLineSpacing.wdLineSpaceExactly
member.summary: Line spacing is only the exact maximum amount of space required. This setting commonly uses less space than single spacing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdLineSpacing.wdLineSpaceMultiple
member.summary: Line spacing determined by the number of lines indicated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdLineSpacing.wdLineSpaceSingle
member.summary: Single spaced. default

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdOMathBreakBin
member.summary: Specifies where Microsoft Office Word places binary operators when equations span two or more lines.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdOMathBreakBin.wdOMathBreakBinAfter
member.summary: Places the operator after a line break, at the beginning of the following line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdOMathBreakBin.wdOMathBreakBinBefore
member.summary: Places the operator before a line break, at the end of the line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdOMathBreakBin.wdOMathBreakBinRepeat
member.summary: Repeats the operator before a line break at the end of the line and after a line break at the beginning of the following line.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdOMathBreakSub
member.summary: Specifies how Microsoft Office Word handles a subtraction operator that falls before a line break.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdOMathBreakSub.wdOMathBreakSubMinusMinus
member.summary: Repeats a minus sign that ends before a line break at the beginning of the next line. Default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdOMathBreakSub.wdOMathBreakSubMinusPlus
member.summary: Inserts a minus sign at the end of the first line, before the line break, and a plus sign at the beginning of the following line, before the number.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdOMathBreakSub.wdOMathBreakSubPlusMinus
member.summary: Inserts a plus sign at the end of the first line, before the line break, and a minus sign at the beginning of the following line, before the number.

member.summary: Adjusts the left edge of the first column, preserving the position of the right edge of the table by setting the widths of all the cells in the specified row or rows to the same value.

member.summary: Represents a window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Window.Close(System.Object@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Closes the specified window.
member.param: Optional Object. True to route the document to the next recipient. If the document doesn't have a routing slip attached, this argument is ignored.
Optional Object. Specifies the save action for the document. Can be one of the following constants: wdDoNotSaveChanges, wdPromptToSaveChanges, or wdSaveChanges.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Window.GetPoint(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the screen coordinates of the specified range or shape.
member.param: Required Integer. The variable name to which you want Microsoft Word to return the value for the left edge of the object.
Required Integer. The variable name to which you want Word to return the value for the height of the object.
Required Integer. The variable name to which you want Word to return the value for the top edge of the object.
Required Object. A or object.
Required Integer. The variable name to which you want Word to return the value for the width of the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Window.LargeScroll(System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Scrolls a window or pane by the specified number of screens.
member.param: Optional Object. The number of screens to scroll the window to the right.
Optional Object. The number of screens to scroll the window up.
Optional Object. The number of screens to scroll the window to the left.
Optional Object. The number of screens to scroll the window down.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Window.PageScroll(System.Object@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Scrolls through the specified pane or window page by page.
member.param: Optional Object. The number of pages to be scrolled up.
Optional Object. The number of pages to be scrolled down. If this argument is omitted, this value is assumed to be 1.

member.summary: Prints all or part of the specified document.
member.param: Optional Object. The type of pages to be printed. Can be any constant.wdPrintAllPages wdPrintEvenPagesOnly wdPrintOddPagesOnly
Optional Object. The width to which you want Word to scale printed pages, in twips (20 twips = 1 point; 72 points = 1 inch).
Optional Object. The height to which you want Word to scale printed pages, in twips (20 twips = 1 point; 72 points = 1 inch).
Optional Object. When printing multiple copies of a document, True to print all pages of the document before printing the next copy.
Optional Object. The number of pages you want Word to fit horizontally on one page. Can be 1, 2, 3, or 4. Use with the PrintZoomRow argument to print multiple pages on a single sheet.
Optional Object. Set to True to append the specified document to the file name specified by the OutputFileName argument. False to overwrite the contents of OutputFileName.
Optional Object. The number of copies to be printed.

Optional Object. The item to be printed. Can be any constant.wdPrintAutoTextEntries wdPrintComments wdPrintDocumentContent wdPrintDocumentWithMarkup wdPrintEnvelope wdPrintKeyAssignments wdPrintMarkup wdPrintProperties wdPrintStyles
Optional Object. The ending page number when Range is set to wdPrintFromTo.
Optional Object. The page range. Can be any constant. wdPrintAllDocumentwdPrintCurrentPage wdPrintFromTo wdPrintRangeOfPages wdPrintSelection

Optional Object. True to print a two-sided document on a printer without a duplex printing kit. If this argument is True, the and properties are ignored. Use the and properties to control the output during manual duplex printing. This argument may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you’ve selected or installed.
Optional Object. The page numbers and page ranges to be printed, separated by commas. For example, "2, 6-10" prints page 2 and pages 6 through 10.
Optional Object. True to send printer instructions to a file. Make sure to specify a file name with OutputFileName.
Optional Object. If PrintToFile is True, this argument specifies the path and file name of the output file.

Optional Object. This argument is available only in Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition. For additional information about this argument, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.
Optional Object. Set to True to have the macro continue while Microsoft Word prints the document.
Optional Object. The number of pages you want Word to fit vertically on one page. Can be 1, 2, or 4. Use with the PrintZoomColumn argument to print multiple pages on a single sheet.
Optional Object. The starting page number when Range is set to wdPrintFromTo.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Window.RangeFromPoint(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the or object that is located at the point specified by the screen position coordinate pair.
member.param: Required Integer. The horizontal distance (in pixels) from the left edge of the screen to the point.
Required Integer. The vertical distance (in pixels) from the top of the screen to the point.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Window.ScrollIntoView(System.Object,System.Object@)
member.summary: Scrolls through the document window so the specified range or shape is displayed in the document window.
member.param: Optional Boolean. True if the top left corner of the range or shape appears at the top left corner of the document window. False if the bottom right corner of the range or shape appears at the bottom right corner of the document window. The default value is True.
Required Object. A or object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Window.SmallScroll(System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Scrolls a window or pane by the specified number of lines.
member.param: Optional Object. The number of lines to scroll the window to the right. A "line" corresponds to the distance scrolled by clicking the right scroll arrow on the horizontal scroll bar once.
Optional Object. The number of lines to scroll the window up. A "line" corresponds to the distance scrolled by clicking the up scroll arrow on the vertical scroll bar once.
Optional Object. The number of lines to scroll the window to the left. A "line" corresponds to the distance scrolled by clicking the left scroll arrow on the horizontal scroll bar once.
Optional Object. The number of lines to scroll the window down. A "line" corresponds to the distance scrolled by clicking the down scroll arrow on the vertical scroll bar once.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XlTrendlineType
member.summary: Specifies how the trendline that smoothes out fluctuations in the data is calculated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XlTrendlineType.xlExponential
member.summary: Uses an equation to calculate the least squares fit through points, for example, y=ab^x .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XlTrendlineType.xlLinear
member.summary: Uses the linear equation y = mx + b to calculate the least squares fit through points.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XlTrendlineType.xlLogarithmic
member.summary: Uses the equation y = c ln x + b to calculate the least squares fit through points.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XlTrendlineType.xlMovingAvg
member.summary: Uses a sequence of averages computed from parts of the data series. The number of points equals the total number of points in the series less the number specified for the period.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XlTrendlineType.xlPolynomial
member.summary: Uses an equation to calculate the least squares fit through points, for example, y = ax^6 + bx^5 + cx^4 + dx^3 + ex^2 + fx + g.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XlTrendlineType.xlPower
member.summary: Uses an equation to calculate the least squares fit through points, for example, y = ax^b.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLMapping
member.summary: Represents the XML mapping on a object between custom XML and a content control. An XML mapping is a link between the text in a content control and an XML element in the custom XML data store for this document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLMapping.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the XML mapping from the parent content control.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLMapping.SetMapping(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Office.Core.CustomXMLPart)
member.summary: Allows creating or changing the XML mapping on a content control. Returns True if Microsoft Office Word maps the content control to a custom XML node in the document’s custom XML data store.
member.param: Specifies the prefix mappings to use when querying the expression provided in the XPath parameter. If omitted, Word uses the set of prefix mappings for the specified custom XML part in the current document.

Specifies the desired custom XML data to which to map the content control. If this parameter is omitted, the XPath is evaluated against all custom XML in the current document, and the mapping is established with the first CustomXMLPart in which the XPath resolves to an XML node.
Specifies an XPath string that represents the XML node to which to map the content control. An invalid XPath string causes a run-time error.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLMapping.SetMappingByNode(Microsoft.Office.Core.CustomXMLNode)
member.summary: Allows creating or changing the XML data mapping on a content control. Returns True if Microsoft Office Word maps the content control to a custom XML node in the document’s custom XML data store.
member.param: Specifies the XML node to which to map the current content control.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLMapping.Application
member.summary: Returns an object that represents the Microsoft Word application.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLMapping.Creator
member.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the add-in was created. Read-only Long.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLMapping.CustomXMLNode
member.summary: Returns a CustomXMLNode object that represents the custom XML node in the data store to which the content control in the document maps.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLMapping.CustomXMLPart
member.summary: Returns a CustomXMLPart object that represents the custom XML part to which the content control in the document maps.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLMapping.IsMapped
member.summary: Returns a Boolean that represents whether the content control in the document is mapped to an XML node in the document’s XML data store. Read-only.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLMapping.Parent
member.summary: Returns an Object that represents the parent object of the specified XMLMapping object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLMapping.PrefixMappings
member.summary: Returns a String that represents the prefix mappings used to evaluate the XPath for the current XML mapping. Read-only.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLMapping.XPath
member.summary: Returns a String that represents the XPath for the XML mapping, which evaluates to the currently mapped XML node. Read-only.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNamespace

member.summary: Attaches an XML schema to a document.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNamespace.Alias(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a String that represents the friendly name for the specified object.
member.param: Optional Boolean. True if all users have access to the specified object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNamespace.DefaultTransform(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a object that represents the default Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformation (XSLT) file to use when opening a document from an XML schema for a particular namespace.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNamespace.Location(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the specified XML namespace.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNamespaces
member.summary: A collection of objects that represents the entire collection of schemas in the Schema Library.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNamespaces.Add(System.String,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a object that represents a schema that is added to the Schema Library and made available to users in Microsoft Word.
member.param: Optional String. The name of the schema as it appears on the Schemas tab in the Templates and Add-ins dialog box.
Required String. The path and file name of the schema. This may be a local file path, a network path, or an Internet address.
Optional Boolean. True if all users that log on to a computer can access and use the new schema. The default is False.
Optional String. The namespace Uniform Resource Indicator as specified in the schema. The NamespaceURI parameter is case-sensitive and must be spelled exactly as specified in schema.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNamespaces.InstallManifest(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Installs the specified XML expansion pack on the user's computer, making an XML smart document solution available to one or more users.
member.param: Optional Boolean. True installs the XML expansion pack and makes it available to all users on a machine. False makes the XML expansion pack available for the current user only. Default is False.
Required String. The path and file name of the XML expansion pack.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNamespaces.Item(System.Object@)
member.summary: Returns an individual object in a collection.
member.param: An Object indicating the ordinal position or a string representing the name of the individual object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNode
member.summary: Represents a single XML element applied to a document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNode.Copy
member.summary: Copies the specified object to the Clipboard.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNode.RemoveChild(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNode)
member.summary: Removes the specified child element from the specified element.
member.param: Required . The child element to be removed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNode.SelectNodes(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a collection that represents all the nodes that match a specified XPath string in the order in which they appear.
member.param: Optional Object. Provides the prefix in the schema against which to perform the search. Use the PrefixMapping parameter if your XPath parameter uses names to search for elements.
Optional Boolean. True skips all text nodes while searching for the specified node. False includes text nodes in the search. Default value is False.
Required String. A valid XPath string. For more information on XPath, see the XPath reference documentation on the Microsoft Developer Network (MSDN) Web site.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNode.SelectSingleNode(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an object that represents the first node that matches a specified XPath string in the specified document.
member.param: Optional Object. Provides the prefix in the schema against which to perform the search. Use the PrefixMapping parameter if your XPath parameter uses names to search for elements.
Optional Boolean. True skips all text nodes while searching for the specified node. False includes text nodes in the search. Default value is True.
Required String. A valid XPath string. For more information on XPath, see the XPath reference documentation on the Microsoft Developer Network (MSDN) Web site.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNode.SetValidationError(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdXMLValidationStatus,System.Object@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Changes the validation error text displayed to a user for a specified node and forces Microsoft Word to report a node as invalid.
member.param: Required . Specifies whether to set the validation status error text (wdXMLValidationStatusCustom) or to clear the validation status error text (wdXMLValidationStatusOK).

Optional Boolean. True automatically clears the error message as soon as the next validation event occurs on the specified node. False requires running the SetValidationError method with a Status parameter of wdXMLValidationStatusOK to clear the custom error text.
Optional Object. The text displayed to the user. Leave blank when the Status parameter is set to wdXMLValidationStatusOK.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNode.ValidationErrorText(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a String that represents the description for a validation error on an object.
member.param: Optional Boolean. Indicates that the error text displayed is the advanced version of the validation error description, which comes from the MSXML 5.0 component included with Microsoft Word.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNode.WordOpenXML
member.summary: Returns a String that represents the XML for the node in the Microsoft Office Word Open XML format. Read-only.
member.param: Specifies whether to return the data contained within the XML only, without XML markup.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNode.XML(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a String that represents the XML text in the specified object.
member.param: Optional Boolean. True returns the text of the XML without the Word XML markup. The default setting is False.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNodes
member.summary: A collection of objects that represents the nodes in the tree view of the XML Structure task pane, which indicates the elements that a user has applied to a document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.XMLNodes.Add(System.String,System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: Returns a object that represents a newly added element.
member.param: Optional Range. The range to which you want to apply the element. The default is to place the element tags at the insertion point or around the selection if a text is selected.

Required String. The name of the schema as defined in the schema. The Namespace parameter is case-sensitive and must be spelled exactly as it appears in the schema. If the specified namespace cannot be found in any of the schemas attached to the document, an error is displayed.

Required String. The name of the element in the XML schema designated in the Namespace parameter. Because XML is case-sensitive, the spelling of the element specified in the Name parameter must be exactly as it appears in the schema. If the String does not match any of the element names in the schema specified in the Namespace parameter, an error is displayed.
